docs.snippet: The startling, double-digital declines in TV viewership raise questions about whether the football and soccer leagues have reached their peak....
docs.lead_paragraph: The startling, double-digital declines in TV viewership raise questions about whether the football and soccer leagues have reached their peak.
docs.abstract: Both English Premier League in Britain and National Football League in United States are facing for first time double-digit drops in television viewership this season, with NFL reporting 12 percent and Premier League reporting almost 20 percent declines; team owners and league executives are facing prospect that they have hit peak, despite years in which two leagues seemed impervious to travails of other programs on broadcast television.

headline.main: TV Viewership Falls in N.F.L. and Premier League: A Blip, or Something Worse?
headline.print_headline: Must-See TV? Not if Viewers Call It ‘Football’

byline.original: By KEN BELSON, RICHARD SANDOMIR and RORY SMITH

docs.snippet: A law professor writes about the struggle to allow therapeutic use while prevent abuse of performance-enhancing substances....

docs.snippet: The league’s entry requirements, N.C.A.A. rules on amateurism and football’s demanding nature mean players must give at least three years to their universities while risking career-ending injuries....
docs.lead_paragraph: The league’s entry requirements, N.C.A.A. rules on amateurism and football’s demanding nature mean players must give at least three years to their universities while risking career-ending injuries.
docs.abstract: Marc Tracy On College Football column discusses how decision by some football players to stay in college through their senior year effects their standing in NFL draft; maintains players who stay longer in college risk injury, which can lower their standing in draft, but could also gain experience and maturity.

headline.main: Eligibility Rules Leave Top N.F.L. Prospects Walking a Perilous Tightrope

docs.abstract: DraftKings and FanDuel agree to $6 million settlement after investigation by New York Atty Gen Eric T Schneiderman's office finds daily fantasy sports companies misled players with deceptive ads.

docs.snippet: Alisports, the sports arm of e-commerce giant Alibaba, is to invest $100 million (81.88 million pound) in Chinese rugby over the next 10 years as part of an initiative to make the world's most populous nation a force in the game, World Rugby said ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Alisports, the sports arm of e-commerce giant Alibaba, is to invest $100 million (81.88 million pound) in Chinese rugby over the next 10 years as part of an initiative to make the world's most populous nation a force in the game, World Rugby said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Chinese Rugby to Get $100 Million, Recruit One Million Players
